page.title: 02WILDLIFE, ST.BREWARD AREA. 1
page.content: THERE IS SO MUCH WILDLIFE IN THE AREA IT WOULD BE {IMPOSSIBLE }TO TELL YOU ALL ABOUT THEM.SO HERE IS SOME INFORMATION ABOUT SOME COMMON AND NOT SO COMMON CREATURES THAT CHOSE TO LIVE IN OUR ENVIRONMENT. {ADDERS } THE ONLY VENOMOUS SNAKE IN CORNWALL WHICH HAUNTS SANDY HEATHS DRY MOORS AND SUNNY SLOPES. THE ADDER PREFERS SMALL ANIMALS SUCH AS SHREWS,MICE,VOLES AND EVEN THE ODD YOUNG WEASELS BUT WILL ALSO TAKE BIRDS,LIZARDS,FROGS AND LARGE SLUGS. THEY APPEAR ABOUT MAY AND HAVE BEEN SEEN COILED ON A SUNNY BANK. THE ADDER IS NOT AT ALL AS DANGEROUS AS PEOPLE MAKE OUT. THEY PREFER TO HIDE AWAY RATHER THAN BITE. { {LENGTH:_}35 CM. {CONTINUED ON PAGE 3.}
